doc:
Paulette Goddard https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paulette_Goddard 0 Paulette Goddard (born Marion Levy; June 3, 1910 – April 23, 1990) was an American actress, a child fashion model and a performer in several Broadway productions as a Ziegfeld Girl; she became a major star of Paramount Pictures in the 1940s. Her most notable films were her first major role, as Charlie Chaplin's leading lady in Modern Times, and Chaplin's subsequent film The Great Dictator. She was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress for her performance in So Proudly We Hail! (1943). Her husbands included Chaplin, Burgess Meredith, and Erich Maria Remarque. Paulette_Goddard ( born Marion_Levy ; June_3_,_1910 – April_23_,_1990 ) was an_American_actress , a_child_fashion_model and a_performer in several_Broadway_productions as a_Ziegfeld_Girl ; she became a_major_star of Paramount_Pictures in the_1940s . Her_most_notable_films were her_first_major_role , as Charlie_Chaplin 's_leading_lady in Modern_Times , and Chaplin 's_subsequent_film The_Great_Dictator . She was_nominated for an_Academy_Award for Best_Supporting_Actress for her_performance in So Proudly We Hail ! (_1943_) . Her_husbands included Chaplin , Burgess_Meredith , and Erich_Maria_Remarque .
